The work function of a metal is \(2.5 \mathrm{eV}\). The maximum kinetic energy of the photoelectrons emitted if a radiation of wavelength \(3000 \mathrm{~A}^{\circ}\) falls on it is :

\(\left(\mathrm{h}=6.63 \times 10^{-34} \mathrm{Js} \text { and } \mathrm{c}=3 \times 10^{8} \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}\right)\)

Calculate the wavelength of an electron if its kinetic energy is \(3.0 \times 10^{-25} \mathrm{~J}\). Mass of an electron is \(9.1 \times 10^{-31} \mathrm{Kg}\) :

Table-tennis ball has a mass \(10 \mathrm{~g}\) and a speed of \(100 \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}\). If speed can be measured within an accuracy of \(10 \%\), what will be the uncertainty in speed and position respectively?

According to Dalton’s atomic theory:
q_option: Atoms are made of electrons, neutrons and protons
Atoms are made of neutrons and protons
Atoms are made of electrons and protons

q_option: Electrons move in circular orbits around nucleus

1.q_string: Rutherford’s α–particle scattering experiment supported the discovery of:
Correct expression for mass number A is:
q_option: A = number of protons (Z)+ number of neutrons (n)
A = number of nucleons (Z) + number of neutrons (n)
A = number of protons (Z)+ number of electrons(n)

1.q_string: Isobars are the atoms with:
q_option: Same atomic number but different number of neutrons
Same mass number but different atomic number
Same atomic number but different mass number
Same number of neutrons but different mass number

1.q_string: Photoelectric effect established that light:
Emission spectrum of a material results from the material's (atom or molecules):
Absorption spectrum, seen as dark lines in an otherwise continuous spectrum, for a given material results from the material's (atom or molecules)
q_option: Absorbing all wavelengths and returning to normal ground state
Absorbing selected wavelengths from an input of continuous spectrum
Absorbing selected wavelengths and returning to normal ground state
Absorbing all wavelengths from an input of continuous spectrum

1.q_string: When an electric discharge is passed through gaseous hydrogen, the H2 molecules dissociate and the energetically excited hydrogen atoms produced emit electromagnetic radiation of discrete frequencies. The hydrogen spectrum consists of:
q_option: Several series of lines named after their discoverers
A continuous spectrum that reduces to zero at small wavelengths
A continuous spectrum that reduces to zero at large wavelengths
